column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: JenJen32, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: When I was first diagnosed with Fibro, over 3yrs ago, my original Dr started me out on Lyrica. I had a HORRIBLE experience with that medication!! I had cr@zy dreams every single night, along w/a handful of other side effects. My current Dr changed me over to Savella over 2yrs ago-thank God! I have to say, I haven't had any major side effects w/this med.(Besides the $$ it's costing me that is). I'm suppose to take 100mg 3x's daily, but have never followed that order. Instead, I take 50mg 2x's daily, because if I take the whole 100mg, I will get veeerryy sleeeepy-I'm a mommy & can't be getting sleepy during the day! I tried taking the 100mg 2x's daily once I got my system use to the dose, but didn't see much difference. Just in price and tiredness! I do get very hot very easily. But I've always tended to sweat easily...think this med adds to that. I have memory problems and difficulty thinking of particular words that I'm trying to use @ any given time. Aggrivating! When I first started the med, it took a good week or so to get going good. I felt all out of wack, and not myself. It's mood altering definately. So if the dose you are prescribed isn't working, don't give up so easily! It's DEFINATELY worth hanging around for. I stopped taking it for several weeks, and felt pretty bad instantly. Could tell such a difference in my total body pain and fatigue right off hand, and definately in my mental and mood states of mind. I'm just waiting for the generic version to come along now...  :-)

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Savella for about 1 month now to help with Fibromyalgia symptoms and to try to get a good nights sleep. On the 25 mg. dose twice a day i slept well at night but noticed after only a few days treatment that I felt like I was in a stupor or trance that lasted two days. Doctor said I needed to stick with it but since being on it at 50 mgs. at night and 25 mgs. in the day I have had feelings of being hostile, angry, crying, aggressive sometimes all in one day.  I have had depression problems for years but never experienced anything like this.  Moods are disproportionate to situations I have been in and I am concerned because I don't know what will trigger these moods or how serious they will get.  I did mention this to the doctor but I don't think it is being taken seriously. I think I will wean myself off this drug, side effects are to much and not worth it in my case.  I can manage better in my life without this emotional roller coaster, feeling more depressed, my behavior isn't characteristic for me. I would say this drug needs to be looked at more closely regarding these type of side effects.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After about six months on Savella, I started having difficulty focusing my right eye on my computer screen. The problem grew very slowly and my optometrist had told me I was developing a cataract in that eye, so I blamed the problem on the cataract.  By the nine-month point, when I started to get a little tired, I could not focus my right eye on the screen at all, although it was somewhat better when I was well-rested.  I went in to have my eyes tested. This was the beginning of three months of changes to my eyeglass prescription, which is extreme to start with (astigmatism).  They would make me new lenses, I wouldn't be able to see any better, so they'd test me again and my prescription had changed since the last time.  I finally figured out that it was just taking an extremely long time for my right eye to adapt to different near focal lengths.  They couldn't get a stable prescription because it depended on how many minutes I had been staring at eye-chart distance before they started.  I mentioned the fibromyalgia and the Savella, but the optometrist had no thoughts on the matter. He speculated that perhaps my problem could be ocular myasthenia gravis. Upon scouring the web to look for side effects of Savella, I noticed that "loss of visual accommodation" is a rare but statistically significant side effect. I cut my dose by half and my vision problems mostly resolved over the course of the next couple of weeks. It is still difficult to read labels in a grocery store though, for example, since my eyes do not adjust quickly enough for scanning at different distances.  Regrettably, I am now stuck with a pair of glasses that matched my last test while on the drug. I need to wait to replace them until I am eligible again for new glasses, given that the prescription ends up costing me about $600 each time.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: angelgran1, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have suffered for years not knowing I had FM. A back injury in 1983 (27 years ago),has caused much suffering since. In 2000 L4 was fused, and since then I have had stenosis, bulging disc and DDD (degenerative disc disease). I was also diagnosed with OA(Osteoarthritis several years ago). After a complete hysterectomy when I was 33(1985)I have suffered with clinical depression trying several different drugs for the depression and pain over the years. I have been on Cymbalta for several years now. It was working fine for the depression. When I was determined last fall, 2011, that I have FM,I was placed on Lyrica along with continuing the Cymbalta because I was told by the dr., and I also read that it is also good for body pain and anxiety as well as depression. The Lyrica worked well for the FM, but when I noticed a sudden weightgain I wanted to discontinue the Lyrica because I didn't want the weight, plus, I didn't want any future medical problems from extra weight.  Boy, was THAT a big mistake.  I have felt like I am living 'hell on earth'. I have wanted to die,tired of the soreness/stif that has returned have been unable to function. With Lyrica, I had gotten back a quality of life that I had not had for a number of years. I have also been having some suicidal thoughts. I was taken off Cymbalta because it is in the same group as Savella so u can't take both, aso doctor is hoping the Savella would help the 'clinical depression' as well as the FM. I have another week to go before it will be a month. If the spikes of depression, crying, irritability does not subside I will drop Savella and go back on Cymbalta and Lyrica or something else for the FM. I experienced 5 days of queasiness when I started the pack beginning w/12.5mg. There has been some ligh dizziness, laziness, and just feeling unable to do or a desire to do...or even live. I don't know what the future holds for me, but I hope I can get some relief soon with Savella or by going on to something else.

column9: I must say this is a great medication for overall pain. Keep in mind that it takes a while to work, as it did for me.  Some people may experience weird side effects.  For me it was breast milk, but that went away.  I would say after about a week and a half I started to feel better, I just didn't hurt as much anymore, and my migraines and headaches were less and less.  One thing I do worn is that it does raise your blood pressure.  I was only on 25 mg.  It was a god send.  The only qualm was that I had to get off it immediately because I had suicidal ideation. But about after a week I went on a smaller dose and it has been working ok.  I have not felt the effects of the 12.5mg.  I am quite sad that it made me feel this way.  This was a great drug, it helped me get off of all my opiate pain killers for a month and half!  I was so sad to restart them again.  I wish people with fibromyaglia would give Savella a chance.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Steph in Alaska, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I want to share advice which I read when first considering this medication. Please remember that it will not work the same for everyone. I am frustrated when I read some reviews saying how bad the drug is or "take it off the market." Savella has been a life saver for me. I could hardly get out of bed each day because of the fibromyalgia pain before I started taking this medication. I had tried Lyrica, Cymbalta, Neurontin, and a couple others of which I forget their name...I couldn't tolerate those other medications and they were much less effective if at all on the fibro pain, insomnia, brain fog, etc. I understand if Savella has not worked for you or made you feel rotten but please don't forget there are other people out there who wouldn't know what to do without it. And if your just starting out and your having a little trouble adjusting, try to stick it out unless you just can't do it. You may find out like I did that it is the best thing out there for you.

column9: Im 60yr old male.Pituartary gland issue with Thyroid.Three yrs pain 24/7, no lie.Doz.of doctors,no help.Finally changed Thyroid dr.& Intern dr. Intern examined me;Neck upper back,sides of neck,calves and other all over body pain.Said I have fibro:Gave me Savella worked immediately.Its been about a month now.i .take 50mg three x a day.Musle pain is still there but covered up.This morning pain in back made me almost go to hospital.I don't know if it is my Thyroid or hormones.I hade a heart attack two yrs ago.So pain in my chest area also was linked to Fibro; but after all I started to take all my meds.And after a hour or so the pain subsided.Im grateful for the ease of pain but if it isn't Fibro: and something else this something else could be worsening and some day may explode! column1: Other
column2: Monalisa, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: My Neurologist prescribed this medication, off label, for Restless Leg Syndrome and severe Periodic Lymb Movement. I have suffered from these and getting worse for over 25 years. I have had full evaluations and tried almost all medications recommended.Savella improved my symptoms about 40 % which was great, except I had severe side effects, most serious arrythmia and increased Blod pressure. I decreased the doses and the relief went way. My doctor wanted me to try to increase it again, but to follow up with my cardiologist. I have CAD and bradycardia. My cardiologist ordered a 24 hr monitor and brushed it off as one more medication that aggravated my cardiac symptoms. Before I could get the monitor I ended up in ER and 6 days on anticoagulants, a cardiac cath where I had a cloth( most likely due to the arrythmia caused by the Savella). I am tired of trying medications. Klonopin worked for the first decade or so. My PLM is so bad( an average of 36 times per hour ) that I live sleep deprived, tired, and my muscles and bones hurt from the kicks. Basically, I can not work, sit thru a movie or stand for long. I know the lack of sleep is affecting my memory and concentration, but I do not want another close call with a clot in my heart.  Please, do not live with bad side effects, RLS or PLM will not kill you. Many of these medications are dangerous, especially to people with other health issues .

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: SUICIDE FROM SAVELLA, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: If you suffer from depression, STAY AWAY FROM THIS DRUG!  I begged my doc not to put me on this drug, then finally agreed to take it.  I did the sample titration package first, then went to just 50 mg per day for about 3 weeks.  Was prescribed by my doc for fibro and depression.  Starting becoming HOSTILE and more and more and more DEPRESSED and anxious.  Had 3 severe panic attacks.  Starting thinking about how I could kill myself.  The thoughts would pass but not for long.  I came home one afternoon after work, was angry with my husband about a home project he was working on, then rounded up enough drugs that I knew would work to kill me.  I swallowed them all, cool as a cucumber, wrote a quick note that I knew my husband wouldn't find right away and went to bed around 6:30 p.m.  I became aware of my surroundings nearly one week later after having been in ICU on a ventilator for 3 days and having no recollection of anything during my nearly one-week hospital stay.  I had reported the suicidal thoughts to some people but kept telling them I wouldn't act on them.  Well I was wrong about that.  I don't remember if it helped my fibro pain but I'd rather have pain then to do something so irrational.  SUICIDE ATTEMPT IS a side effect of this drug, especially if you have depression.  The drug was probably within 5 minutes of causing me to die.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: sportmodel, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Dx with FM several years ago, I tried lyrica and cymbalta as well as others in an attempt to feel better. None of which helped, but actually made me worse! Savella is the only medicine that I've noticed a benefit. I had 2 months of really bad nausea-all day long! Much better now, gotta have something in tummy b4 I take med., for me animal crackers help. Sweating is not as bad either. Heart rate is high though, in 110-120's so I need to talk to doc about that, hate feeling like I'm racing and not even moving. HUGE concern for me was fact that I couldn't take my migraine medicine (relplax)anymore. They don't mix...this leaves me suffering through the migraines! And a BIG benefit for me was that this is the only medicine that helped with my depression, and I've tried a bunch, all of which gave me thoughts of suicide. This is probably the biggest reason I still take the Savella! I agree with other posts that if you miss some dosages you quickly feel the pain of FM, so it must be working. Although I still hurt, no magic wand for me. No big difference on fatigue, sleep quality or fog. Like I said helped with my depression and with that heavy feeling lifted some, at least now I can try to move in a positive direction to feel better, really wanting to find strength to exercise and see where that takes me with pain and fatigue. Unfortunately, fibro is not my only concern. God Bless and I hope this helps...

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles

column9: 42 yr old f- Was prescribed WAY too many narcotic meds for Fibromyalgia pain after a 2004 car accident. In 2009, I went into a detox to get off the narcotics & try Savella. I didn't think it was working well until I DIDN'T take it one day! The pain in my joints became fierce & I was totally stiff. I'm on 200mg a day & still have to use Hydrocodone for breakthru pain, but wouldn't give up the Savella for anything! It causes some mild nausea for a short time & it makes me sweat differently. It took over a year to find a deoderant that made it possible to not pass out from my own smell! Otherwise, I don't see it causing me any problems. Certainly NOTHING compared to being on a grip of narcotics, that's for sure!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: juliam33, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was just diagnosed with fibromyalgia a couple of weeks ago but have shown symptoms of it since my middle twenties. No one could touch me without pain and I hurt all the time. My primary doctor diagnosed me with bulging discs and osteoarthritis(degeneration of my lower spine)recently. He recommended I go to an orthopedic doctor for shots in my spine.  I opted instead to go to a rheumotologist to get the correct treatment rather than cortisone shots which I have read do not help after awhile. The rheumatologist told me that the fibro is what is causing the pain and not the bulging discs or the degeneration.  He recommended Savella due to the other medicines causing weight gain which I cannot handle due to losing weight slowly with a medical weight loss program. While taking the starter pack so far, the best I felt was on the two 25 mg tablets a day rather than the 50 mg two times a day.  Once on the two 50mg tabs, my heart started racing and pain seemed to come back while I have felt more nauseous.  The slight nauseousness is not a bad thing for me as it has killed my appetite a bit so I'm sticking to my weight loss plan better.  While on the 25mg part of the pack, I felt fatigue but felt less pain so I'm waiting and seeing what is going to happen. I now have severe pain in the neck and lower back stiffness/pain but have had trouble with them both for a long time. I am feeling better while sitting because before, I could not sit on a chair for hardly any length of time without pain in my tailbone.  That pain has diminished greatly. I'm going to try going to a massage therapist for my neck and back I am also using moist and dry heating pads.  The moist heat really helps the most right now.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have Fibromyalgia (FMS), Typee 2 Diabetes w/Neuropathy, Deg. Joint Disease (D.J.D.)& herniated discs & vertebraes in neck & back~~chronic pain issues. I was first given Cymbalta, but couldn't take that due to the side effects & it wasn't helping. The Dr. switched me to Savella. I've been through the started pack & am now taking 100 mg. a day (50 2 x's day). I haven't noticed a difference. I'm still in constant pain all over & still have some of the side effects. I'm beginning to think doctors think Fibro, CFS, etc is all in your head since they are quick to prescribe anti depressants. I have been taking pain meds, muscle relaxants & pain patches. These worked so much better for me, but in a lot of states doctors do NOT want to prescribe meds that help and are for pain. I'm also worried about long term effects of fairly new drug, as well as , the cost since there isn't a generic yet.  More awareness, research, education is needed on Fibro, Lupus, CFS & other Neuro Immune Endocrine Disorders~~as these ARE NOT in our head. We have a neurological illness. If this is working for those of you have said you got relief in 2 wks, that's great, but it is NOT working for me.

column9: Took a while to work up to dosage, as it did cause the warned side effects of nauseousness but the end benefits are worth it.  I have had fibromyalgia for years and had gotten to where I couldn't function through the week or the day on some days. Savella has made a tremendous difference in my life at this point.  I now have an increase in bp and heart rate that we are monitoring to see if it is due to the med or what...I hope I don't have to stop this med because it has made such a difference in my life.  The difference in body temp is a bother but I always was a little on the cold side anyway.  Overall, the benefit has been worth the side effects.  Good luck to those who try it and don't give up on it too soon.  Make soda crackers and ginger ale your friend for a while and see if you can get through the nauseousness.  It does go away.

column2: NCurry603, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Let me start by saying, I didn't remember how great it felt not to have constant pain! I am in my second week on the 2 week titration pack and feel so much better already. As for the side affects I was worried about nausea but I've only experinced it one day and that was the day I went from 25mg to 50mg that morning.  I actually had dry heaves but it went away.  I do have terrible hot flashes and some sweating but it does go away as quick as it came.  I was just told by my Doctor that I have fibromyalgia.  I've been living with this pain for over a year and just thought it was because I was getting old...43yrs old. Do not hesistate to try Savella it is worth a try. Thank Savella for giving my life back!!!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Aiello5, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: TAKE IT SLOW!INCREASING DOSAGE TOO QUICK MADE ME ALMOST GIVE UP!Began taking Savella in May, 2011. Tried to get up to the regular dose of 100 mg/day, but due to severe side effects (headache, nausea, general overall sick feeling) I was only able to stay at 12.5 mg/day for several months. Was ready to throw in the towel within the first week, but then I noticed more energy/less pain. I have had leg, hip, knee, back, neck and shoulder pain for years, and this was the first time I was pain free from the waist down! I do have the hot flashes and sweats, rapid heart beat, nausea and occassional headache and sick feeling within hour of taking Savella, as well as right hip pain in a.m., but for the most part this drug allows me to live a normal life. I dont wake up feeling like I have been hit by a truck anymore. In Sept, 2011 I increased to 25 mg/day, but side effects returned - but tolerable. I am hoping that the side effects will lessen in a week or two. I increased dosage since I still have neck, arm/shoulder pain, which I am hoping Savella can take care of, since from the waist down I feel pretty good. My brain fog has also been better, but not totally gone. My migranes have also lessened. I still require medication for sleep, since Savella does keep me up at night if I dont take it early enough in the day.  I believe that for most people, increasing the dosage quickly (like in the starter pack) is just too much too soon.  Try the low dose for at least 2 weeks to a month-maybe longer, before increasing if you are having side effects, that definetly helped me, or I would have given up on it.I am glad that I did not, since I feel better than I have in years. It may not take all symptoms away, but at least I am able to walk without pain most of the time.  I also have Lupus, so I have to take that into consideration. My only concern is how new this drug is, and that we may not have all the info necessary to see the long term side effects down the road and the price

column9: I have been fighting Fibro for 13 years....no help from Lyrica so PCP put me on Savella.....I lost 8 pounds the first week!!!! I had horrible nausea and battled it for 5 months although I was only on Savella for 3 weeks. I couldn't get off of Savella fast enough. I call it the pill from HELL!!! I found the side effects to be totally debilitating. After weaning off the drug I still had nausea and continued to lose weight. I eventually ended up having gallblader surgery last week. So far the nausea has subsided. After I had my experince with Savella I read the side efects.....the very first one is NAUSEA!!!! What a surprise!!!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: ScooterSaurus,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had symptoms of fibromyalgia for almost 4 years & was formally diagnosed 11 months ago. After Lyrica failed to do me any good, my doctor prescribed Savella.  He told me it could be a couple of weeks before I started getting any relief: imagine my surprise when I started feeling better within days!  It doesn't completely take care of all of the symptoms, but the "fibro fog" was improved a LOT and the pain diminished by at least 75%. Due to a pharmacy snafu, I have not had any Savella in 4 says & I can tell the difference... it's a huge, excruciating difference! I'm looking forward to being able to get my refill tomorrow!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: o8e23q, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After being diagnosed with FM two years ago, it seemed the pain would never stop. My doctor recommended Savella and I figured why not try it. The pain has definitely gotten easier to deal with however, the side effects is like trading one for the other. I get extremely nauseous to the point where I will start to throw up. I also experience a fast heart beat and hot flashes. Right now I'm still on a low dosage of 50MG and it does give me more energy but I seem to crash pretty hard early in the night getting extremely tired yet its still hard to sleep. I am hoping these side effects will lighten up over time. I would say try it if you are having a hard time finding the energy to do anything. I started going on daily walks and stretching all throughout the day which seems to be helping a lot. This medication will not solve all your problems but it will help you get your life back and start living healthier.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Finfan13, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Well first let me say I know pain very well. I have a cervical fusion from C4 to C7 and it is constantly in pain. I am on 75mcg/hr fentanyl patch for this pain. I have a bulging disc at L4 in lumbar spine that is very painful and prevents me from walking very far. Since I was diagnosed with fibromyalgia a number of years ago it has progressively worsened over time. In the beginning 150 mg Lyrica twice a day helped but in recent months it did nothing as my entire body was in severe pain to the point I was spending over 20 hours a day in bed miserable with pain. Was prescribed Savella on 1 august 2011 was given the titration package. After only 4 days at of taking 50mg am & 50mg pm I have say 65% to 75% of my fibromyalgia pain is gone. So far so good. No side affects yet. Keeping my fingers crossed too. I am sleeping better and now awake feeling rested whereas before Savella I might sleep 6 hours but when I awakened it felt like I had not slept at all. I am hoping the improvement continues as I am starting to feel human again after feeling like a miserable useless lump of pain for so long. I never gave up but I can understand how some do. Savella is working wonderfully for me so far and I wish I could have been on it so many years ago. I realize it is still quite early in my reviewing this drug but if there are any changes I do promise to update with more reviews as needed

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: mom_of_3, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I take Savella for Fibromyalgia pain along with degenerative disc disease,and spinal stenosis. I decided not to follow the mfg dosing directions as I know my body and started with 12.5mg a day for two weeks and then added 12.5 every two weeks until I got to 100 mg a day. It took me several months to get there. I know if had started with 50mg a day like some people have I would have ran screaming too from it. My biggest complaint about this drug is the hot flash/sweats. I think it helped relief the nerve pain but I still have pain in my muscles that I take other medication for and of course exercise and watch my diet. If you sensitive to medication better to start with a lesser dose and work your way up like I did and you might just find that this is a good drug for you. I took Cymbalta for 18 months before this and just didn't get the relief I needed. So as I was lowering my dosage of Cymbalta I was increasing my dose of Savella. It was a 4 month transition from one drug to the other. It wasn't horrible but there was a couple of days I did feel a little odd but doing it 12.5 mg at a time made it more tolerable. If I had listened to my doctor and just went from Cymbalta to Savella without tritating down on one and up on the other I would have been at the hosptial. No drug works in a day and if you are sensitive to meds and if it is a drug you can split with a pill splitter like this one then do so and take it slowly to increase to the full dose.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: mitzielou, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: When I started this medication I was very hesitant due to the side effects.  However I was in extreme pain every single day and decided to try it.  My doctor gave me the trial pack and I started out on the 12.5 mg and I am now on the 50mg. two times a day.  The very lst day after starting the night before I feel great!  Most of my stiffness, and pain has gone completely away.  My only issue is being "HOT" !  I looked up other comments and noticed being hot was a side effect.  I hope and pray it goes away as I continue the medication.  When I am hot or sweaty I feel like a french fry dripping in grease.  My pain is very extreme and I did not or am not able to do anything worthwhile.  Hopefully the sweats will decrease.  Not sure at this moment which is worse.  The pain???  or being sweaty all the time???  I am thinking I would rather sweat though than be in pain!  I have a spray bottle of water in the fridge and spray myself with cold misty water often.  It feels refreshing and I stay cool after that for a couple of hours.  However, I just started this medicine 10 days ago and we are having a heat wave here in Florida.  No other side effects noticed and I am pretty sure I feel so much better all over!   Good Luck to everyone.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Mommie2KK, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My doctor has recently diagnosed me with Fibromyalgia and prescribed Savella. (Probably 4-5 months ago now.)  My main initial side effects were occasional headaches and feeling hot/sweating.  At the very beginning there was a little nausea but that passed pretty quickly. I work in a child care center and my main continuing side effect is the sweating/feeling hot. I move around a lot anyway but the heat is miserable. After 2 months or so at full dose I asked my doc if there was anything else I could switch to, but he said this is the best we have right now. I finally got tired of it and weaned myself off of it (slowly) but then realized just how much the medication had been helping me. The daily pain and stiffness returned and needless to say, I'm back on it. I do worry about what the medication might be doing to me long term though ... I tried to donate blood and my heart rate was too high. It needed to be under 100 to donate and it was 112. They took it 10 minutes later and it was up to 119. I thought it was probably the Savella, so I skipped it that night and figured I'd take it after my appointment the next morning. Went back and tried again and it was 104, then 10 minutes later 102. I've stayed off of it and will go back one more time to try to donate tomorrow, if not I'm giving up because the pain is returning and I need to get back on the Savella at least until I can see the pain specialist I'm being referred to. I guess it's a matter of if you can live with the side effects or not. I'd love to not feel like I'm burning up all the time but I sure don't like hurting so much and being so stiff. Good luck!!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Anonymous, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Fibromyalgia is a sentence.  I would rather have the stigma associated with being a "druggie" because I need to take Percocet to get through the day.  I cannot fathom getting intermittent improvement with such serious side effects that no one seems to know whether or not will be lifelong, i.e. heart problems.  I don't want to suffer through the withdrawals of this nasty drug.  So far, extreme bloating from first week, weight gain, fatigue, flu-like symptoms, extreme agitation, benefit of leg relief however now have extreme tender points in upper body, pulling aches in arms worse, resting heart rate 100+, heart palpitations, cannot exercise without suffering the consequences, manufacturer has drug on backorder, not only is the drug not working - the company cannot even stock it - not to mention the price - Maybe this time the insurance companies are on to something.   At least Percocet and the generics cost me $10.00 and they help.  Good luck folks and be careful and forewarned.  This drug is perceived as safe but actually dangerous in my opinion.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: josh, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i am 26, male, and have been living with fibro about 4yrs now, have major depression, anxiety, insomnia, manic thoughts, the works. just got insurance and the doc put me on savella. been going for about a month now. at first i was freaked, the issues with side effect seemed to outweigh the benefits. i got a uti, sore testes, crawling skin, hot flashes, you name it. the doc gave me antibiotics and the uti and groin pain are gone, the skin tingling has become mild and usualy breif. when i got up to 50 2x a day they became more intense so my doc put me at 25mg 2x. and its been pretty easy to handle. i feel much better. it has helped my mood tremendously and although the pain isnt gone and i still have insomnia i don't wake up in pain anymore, i have more energy and the manic thinking has been seriously reduced. i havent felt this well mentally or physicaly in a long time... take it with food. if it is absored too fast i find the side effects become more apparent, stay hydrated, and try to keep a positive attitude. its definitly not for everyone and at first i was cursing the guy who gave it to me but i feel there is some merit to this med. possibly more for those with MDD like me. again the pain is not gone but i do feel much better. we'll see what the future holds.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: cynthea, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It is too early for me to rate the stars above! I have taken 2 days and slept poorly- I can live with that, but felt so bad this am called in sick at 0400. I thought maybe I should stop, but after reading this site of well organized fast and easy to read reviews: http://www.askapatient.com/viewrating.asp?drug=22 256&name=SAVELLA&PerPage=80&sort=sati sfaction&order=0Everyone said to keep going!! The side effects are the worst the first week or so, and you need to give it 1-2 months to know for sure. Wow- I am really glad to hear the hot flashes, sweating, even nausea will decrease. Also, just felt awful this am, bit of a headache and don't know how to characterize yukky :)) But before you quit ,if you are just starting like me check out this site in addition to this one. Another site with many pages of reviews, slower to read like this site is:http://www.prescriptiondrug-info.com/Discuss /ANYONE-ELSE-TRYING-SAVELLA-FOR-FIBROMYALGIA-1954 24_s2.htmI will post an update of my results. I am just glad I decided to review nonscientific patient anecdotal comments, because nowhere in the prescribing literature did I see that side effect symptoms may be worse initially and taper off, just keep going unless life threatening! I really did not realize how debilitating the side effects are for many. the numbers show 35% have nausea 19% headache and other side effects are less. Maybe only those with side effects are posting, however many with side effects state they decrease with time and the beginning is the worse; they also report a great decrease in pain. My pain decreased tremendously on day 1, but mine varies a lot so I didn't know if this is the med or just me.Keep reading before you decide to quit!! :)

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: MisFraz, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 31yr old female that was recently dx with Fibromyalgia & Chronic Fatigue Immne Dysfunction Syndrome. My Rhuematologist gave me Savella and told me to get to 50mg twice a day. The morning after the first night, I awoke with NO vision in my right eye. It was one of the scariest things ever. Thankfully, it did clear up in an hiour or so. The nausea was horrible. I am now up to 50mg a day, where I will stop and I still have the ugly nausea feeling if I don't eat soon enough. I was already on Nortyriptylene for Migraines which I had to stop. My headaches & migraines are every day now. I saw my dr last week and she said for me to start the Nort. back up one every other night but NO more than that. I think the biggest side effect that is hampering my daily life is the lack of sleep. It has worsened a great deal. My old go-to remedies such as Tylenol PM or Excedrin PM are no longer of any assistance. My dr suggested to try Bendaryl before bed before she gives me a script for something stronger. As far as helping with pain, the med has helped most areas minus my right hip which seems worse these days.Good Luck to All!

column1: Other
column2: nancyl63, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have some relief with this drug. But i cannot take 50 mg. twice a day. I take 50 mg. @ night. my heart rate goes up to 125-135 beats a minute. And if i take the full dose it goes up to 165 beats a minute. I do not have any other side efects except this. That is why I take @ bedtime because I do not need to worry about getting out of breath. column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: CSS in FL, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Hello,I was given this medication for my undiagnosed, until now, CSS (Central Sensitivity Syndrome.)  My doctor said the aim of me taking Savella (SNRI) is to up the   norepinephrine levels in my brain.  Serotonin is not why I am taking it, but the SRI in Savella swapped nicely for the 10 mg prozac (SSRI) migraine prophylactic I discontinued.  I have been on Wellbutrin (SNDRI) 150 mg twice a day for many years.  The literature I read on CSS - of which fibromyalgia is one of a dozen+ manifestations (including chemical sensitivity!!!) clearly urges starting patients on the lowest  dose, then slowly titrate from there.  My doctor told me to take it (12.5 mg) only once a day for two to three weeks, then begin two dosages a day.  The last night of week two I could tell that I had not yet plateaued from the 12.5 mg I was already taking and needed to wait another week before going to 2 doses/day.  By morning, my cognitive function  frustrated me, so the heck with it.  I took a morning dose.  Well that lasted only a day!  It was too much to go from 12.5 mg to 25 mg in one jump.  (I hope some docs are reading my testimonial!)  I used my new pill cutter!  Now I am taking 6.25 mg AM & 12.5 mg PM.  Why are patients receiving dosages far from the lowest as their starting point on this drug?  The literature with Savella clearly states slowly titrating the dosage.  Are these patient's doctors reading the Savella dosage instructions?If patients are starting this drug at 50 mg twice a day, as I have read of here, no wonder people are having such bad reactions.  Dosage wrong?My pain has decreased significantly and I have had no major side effects - though I can definitely tell when the drug kicks in.  I do have a wave of "reorientation" as my brain/body adjusts - but this passes and I may eat something if my stomach is empty. I have had 9 or 10 CSS conditions for 30+ years.  I may never exceed 25 mg a day. I am drug sensitive. Less is more for me which may work w/Savella.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: SherylAnne1957, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Be very cautious if you are going to try the Savella.  The first 2 weeks taking this med I had the nausea side affect pretty mildly and was pain free.  It was like a miracle drug for Fibromyalgia pain.  The med leveled off in my system and I continued to take it.  After about 6 mos I started having severe IBS attacks which I blamed on the Fibromyalgia.  I went to an internist and many tests were performed over the next several months.  After 12-13 mos of taking Savella I went on medical leave and my PCP took me off all meds to see what was happening to my body since there was nothing physically wrong with my gastro system.  My BP was through the roof, I lost at least 3-5 lbs a week and couldn't leave my bathroom.  I went off the Savella and approximately 7 - 10 days later my body started to recover and the IBS had stopped.  My FM pain was through the roof and the migraines were terrible and my BP was dangerously high.  The Savella had ravaged my body far worse than the FM had ever affected it.  I was off work for 10 weeks and spent literally thousands of dollars in medical tests to see what was happening to my body with them all coming back in normal range.  My stomach lining was very irritated and I was on some hefty stomach and gastro meds to try to alleviate the symptoms.  Stopping the Savella was what worked to alleviate all of the issues.  I am now on 2 separate Blood pressure meds because of what the Savella did but I am off all gastro meds.  The risks and side affects far outweigh any type of benefit from the Savella.

column1: Other
column2: skyler, 45-54 Female  (Patient)
column9: I wrote a review on this before but after reading more of other reviews I realized I had a few more side effects that I didn't realize could come from Savella.... the vision issue if I was stressed or extremely tired and weird dreams.  I do state, once again, this has been a miracle drug for me.  The brain fog is almost gone and my fatigue is so much better. I still have pain and am still taking tramadol but the Savella helps the tramadol work lots better and has helped me cut the dosage. I do wish the headaches would go away permanently but I'll take those over all the other symptoms Savella has helped. column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Mishmouse, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I am posting after having been off Savella for months now. When I first starting taking it it was like a miracle, really. I felt so much better. It took the edge off of my constant pain, and cleared my head, allowed me to function almost at my pre-fibro dianostic level. But, unfortunately, it started to cause horrible sweating, which became my breaking point. I would sweat all the time, no matter what, and it was uncomfortable and embarassing. I was so angry that side effect started because it had helped me so much! Also, I agree with a lot of the reviews that it made me hungry all the time too, whether the docs say that's a side effect or not. I gained a significant amount of weight, despite being more active. I would totally recommend trying this drug, and I hope you don't experience any of the negative side effects like I did. I would still be taking it if I hadn't experienced them!

column9: I suffered with pain in legs, arms and back and fatigue for over 4 years.  I had been taking lyrica and cymbalta but when the doctor increased lyrica, my legs swelled. Less than a week ago I went to an arthritis/autoimmune specialist.  He gave me Savella.  I took one pill and my pain started to diminish.  The following day I had no pain.  I am still in awe.  I consider it a miracle.  After 4 years of pain I now am pain-free.  I only hope this continues.  I am on 50 mg once a day for the first week, then I go up to twice a day.  I pray that I will be able to take this and that it keeps working for the rest of my life.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles

column9: I started on savella in mid September and after only 2 days I began to have symptoms...heart palpatations, chest pressure, hot flushes and shortness of breath. I was only on 25 mg. I wasn't aware of any of the side effects only that it may causse nausea.  I reported symptoms to my doctor but I wanted to try to make it work. Continued with pack and up to 50 mg with increased symptoms. By the time I took the 100 mg. the chest pressure and shortness of breath was too much. It felt like someone was standing on my chest. Contacted doctor and they decreased back to 50 mg a day since I could feel there was some progress with my pain. I did report to my doctor my right big toe went numb after only on medicine 10 days. Doctor seemed to think it was from the savella but numbness should stop.It never has. And, two toes on my left foot also became numb and are still numb. I really wanted this to work so I stayed with it until the first of November when I had an episode of severe chest pain and increased symptoms. Doctor decreased medication over a period of a few weeks and I'm glad to be off of this medication. However, I still experience symptoms and had two additional episodes of severe chest pain. If you are able to take savella without the side effects that I and others have had you are lucky. I did feel that it was helping me.

column2: Yolonda A, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been on many meds with bad side effects due to fibro and degenerative disk disease. This is the worst! I can't take this medication. I thought if I could just get through the first 4 weeks, I could handle the side effects. I'm not going to make it! I've always hung in there and toughed it out to get through the side effects of other meds. Dr prescribed anti-nausea pills at day 3, this stopped the nausea.  Can't sleep, pharmacist tells me to take Benadryl instead of my normal allergy meds to help me sleep. I feel depressed, have no appetite, forcing myself to eat. I've awakened every morning drenced in sweat (not like night sweats from menopause), to hip pain that never existed before. I've experienced dizziness every day. I feel weak and thought perhaps my blood pressure was running high, have always had low blood pressure and a low pulse rate. Truck driver husband came home on Day 4, not happy that I feel so sick, wants to talk to the dr himself on Monday. Day 5, I wake up at 6 a.m., can hear blood rushing through my ears. Hubby pulls out blood pressure cuff.  Blood pressure HIGH! Pulse rate at 94!I don't want my pulse rate at 94 when I wake up, I want it back down to 70, where it should be.  I feel as if I'm being poisened, honestly.  I won't take these meds any longer.I'm going to ask Dr to put me back on my Cymbalta and baclofen. I'd rather deal with the little bit of pain! I was pretty happy with the treatment plan I was on.  I'm going back there! I'm happy to read this med has helped so many people, I'm not going to be one of them though.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: PlanetJanet, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with fibromyalgia 15 years ago.  I've tried many, many medications.  I've had some relief from pain with vicodin and some relief from anxiety with klonopin.  I've tried several antidepressants over the years.  I don't remember the last time I woke up and actually felt refreshed after 8 or 9 hours of sleep.  I was up to 4 vicodin a day and realized this much was actually causing more pain and sleep problems.  Dr. prescribed Savella.  It caused nausea, cold symptoms, insomnia, increased anxiety, horrible dry-mouth and weight gain.  I believe the titration pack is too fast and not everyone needs 100 mg/day.  I worked up to the 100 mg/day along with enduring the bad side effects, thinking I had to give it a chance to work and maybe the side effects would go away.  I decreased down to 50 mg/day for a couple weeks and still had no improvement, then down to 25 mg/day for another couple weeks.  I gave this drug a chance for 2 months.  This med did not help me and I am angry that the co-pay was $125.  I want my money back.  I think this med can work for some people, but ask your doctor to titrate you more slowly and reconsider the recommended dosage.  Also ask you doctor to give you enough trial packs to get you to the point where you know it is actually helping, before spending money on getting a script filled.

column2: RZ, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed Savella for Fibromyalgia a few months after its release last year. My doctor gradually increased my dosage up to 100 mg. After a few weeks, I broke out into excessive sweating while doing minor activity, like normal walking. My worst experience was while in physical therapy doing five minutes on a stationary bike. I was sweating like I had run a marathon, couldn't cool down, my BP & my heart rate shot up and I became light-headed. My physical therapist was so concerned she wanted me to see a doctor right away. My BP normally runs really low. So, I can only imagine what this medication must do to people with high blood pressure. My PCP had to decrease my dosage by half. It is not as effective for the pain and I don't sleep. I still have excessive sweating on occasion from minor activity. About two weeks ago, I walked around my yard & broke out into a sweat, couldn't breathe and my heart rate shot up.

column2: Mag, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I started this med when it was in the trial phases and I knew I was not taking the placebo the very first day.  The first thing that improved was my energy-no more fatigue, then my sleep, then my pain. I have been taking it for 3 years. There are many side effects including a drippy nose. The worst is the hot flashes and high blood pressure but the benefits out weigh the side effects. My doctor just increases my blood pressure meds. It is expensive and my insurance has a high deductible.  Good news-I can work because I am not suffering much anymore so I will pay the price they want for it. The great thing is I do not gain weight with this drug (like all the others) in fact I lost a little weight! I take 75 mgs. 2 times a day and I started at 25mgs -had to increase as time went on and i can still go up to 200 a day but do not want to.  Again-there are side effects and i had most of them but I feel like a person again I am out of the fog and on a scale of 1-10 pain level is at a 2 most days. I still have a flare periodically but it does not last much longer that a few days and I can still function. At the end of my trial period they wanted me to participate in the tapering off program and I refused--I will not give up this medication.  I am alive again!  Thanks to the makers of Savella.

column9: Difficult to review this drug. Just took my first pill. My main concern is interactions and precautions. Almost everything it warns you against I have!! I had a heart attack 2 months ago. They found 2 dozen ulcers in my stomach 5 days after that. I am on Dextroamphetamine salts for fatigue. I have borderline personality disorder w\ Bi-polar tendencies, I am on high blood pressure meds, aspirin daily (for heart), and Plavix among other drugs after my heart attack. Since starting my heart meds you can look at me and I will bruise. I told her when she gave me the starter packs that it "acted like an anti-depressant" and I stopped her right there. "Whoa, don't go messing around in my head. You know what disorder I have. Only a licesensed Pyschiatrist should be in there" She assured me it would be OK. I was doubtful. Now I read all of the precautions and side effects and wonder what in the world this woman was thinking? BTW this isn't my Physiatrist, it's her PA. I've been trying to demand an appt. with the actual doctor for 2 months now and she's always out. I do not want to see her flunkie. Especially after this. I do not think I will take another one of these pills tomorrow. This woman must of lost her freaking mind. Why not just up my Norco one pill a day?? Why risk someone with a history of mental illness, a recent heart attack, a prescription for Dextroamphetamines and meds that cause her to bruise easier and keep her BP low on this stuff?? I don't think she even bothered to read the full set of precautions etc. I am printing all of this out and taking it to my next appointment.

It also states non-habit forming, but the reviews I am reading show otherwise if you experience withdrawls, and withdrawls, when you have to go through them people should be a BIG RED FLAG that a medication is indeed addictive and can be hell if you need to withdrawl from it. TAKE IT SERIOUSLY.!!!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: When I first went on the Savella I had pain that increased quite a bit.  The Dr. had warned me that this would take 48-72 hours to take effect, and this was the case.The next few weeks things got better.  I had aching legs at night, but the severe pain decreased greatly.  After three and a half weeks I went up to 100mg twice a day.  The aching legs stopped, but I started having extreme pain at night and in the morning, especially in my elbows, shoulder blades, knees, and ankles.After 6 weeks the Dr. said to go back to 50 since the 100 didn't help so much.  I did and the next morning was in extreme pain so I took the 100 again.  Waited two more days and took the 50 again and same effect.  Took 100 again for a couple of days.At that point I realized I was going through withdrawal symptoms when I  went from the 100 to the 50.  I also noticed that about 6 hours after taking the 100 I was in severe pain, but couldn't take my meds for another 6 hours.So, now I'm going off of it because as I increase the dose my symptoms get worse in between uses.  The Dr. said I shouldn't be having withdrawal symptoms, but everything else I read says I should expect severe withdrawal symptoms.

Also after walking a bit more say the length of my hall way I'd have to stop grab and my sight was going totally black both eyes. would clear after a few moments and I'd regain surroundings was like a black vail over my eyes thing still would be blurry and appeared gray and fuzzy this would happen each time I stood. Living alone I after taking it for two weeks have stopped, for my own personal saty and protection....I could not function. Had a little depression while taking this drug also.... I've tried Lycria and it made me stumble and light headed along with breathing difficulty. chest pains and ended up in the hospital? Is there an ingredient thats the same in both these medication...if so I must be allergic..? tried looking ingredients up but unable to find information???? can I be emailed the information?  Thx

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles

column9: This was prescribed to me for my Fibromyalgia pain that I've had since before Dr's actually believed in Fibromyalgia.  This along with Vicodin has been a real, true miracle!  I can sleep all night now, I can get my house picked up/cleaned, my mood is much 'softer' and I can focus!!  These are all things I couldn't do for years. column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles

column9: I have been taking Savella for 6 mos following fibromyalgia diagnosis.  I take Maxalt or Immitrex for migraines and had a severe reaction the one time I tried Cymbalta and my doctor ruled out Lyrica for me also. I am still taking Celexa for depression. Have had no adverse reactions and actually a possible decrease in migraines.  It has helped my overall pain levels and I seem much better able to cope with work and tasks.  Only side effect that bothers me is increased sweating.  I guess I can live with that.  Better than having to lie down every couple of hours.  Much better than not being able to work at all.

column9: I was on fluoxetine, mirapex, and lyrica.  I weened myself from fluoxetine and mirapex.  I am so glad I did because I do not like putting drugs in my system!  I noticed no difference in coming off the fluoxetine and mirapex, so I am wondering if I ever really need them.  I have been taking Lyrica for about 10 months.  I was still having severe upper leg muscle pain and could not even put on tennis shoes and tie them, get out of bed, sit down and get up, get in and out of a car without just wanting to scream.  I went to the doctor last week in tears.  He put me on sevella...a miracle drug for me!!  My pain level was 8/10, now I would say it is 2/10.  I have been on sevella for 8 days and could tell a remarkable difference on day 2.  I have more energy and am sleeping lots better.  I was hoping to get off Lyrica, but I may need the combination...I will have to wait and see how everything plays out.

The biggest plus since getting off the Savella is my energy level has increased ten-fold.  My husband has even told me to take a break. Only taking Advil, Flexeril as needed and Ambien nightly for sleep.

column9: I have a love/hate relationship with this drug. It has helped me regain a considerable portion of my life but it has come with some consequences. I have much less fibro fog, less pain and more energy but I also have nausea, easier to irritate and night sweats. In the beginning I also had headaches and elevated BP but these diminished over time and are now gone, I am hopeful the other side effects will diminish as well. For me this is still like a miracle, and I am willing to put up with the side effects to see the results I am now experencing. I am even able to go camping again!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Edie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I titrated off Cymbalta and on to Savella as directed about one month ago.  This has evidently triggered migraines which have lasted for that time. I have not had a migraine headache for over a year.  I did not connect them with the Savella because I had changed another med, but this has been eliminated.   My blood pressure has also increased.  I am going off the Savella as soon as I can.  The mere inclusion of "headaches" as a side effect is not enough.  In my opinoion, no one who has a history of migraines should chance this product without being specifically warned. BTW, I take Savella with food, and do not have severe nausea problems, especially after about two weeks.  So for some people with fibromyalgia this may be the answer, but not if you are being treated for high blood pressure or tend to have migraines.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Lon VanOstran, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been on Savella for over 2 months now. I experienced slight improvement for the first month, then had 14 trigger point injections, hoping the combination would give me some real improvement. No such luck. The trigger point injections sent me into the worst fibromyalgia flare up I've ever experienced. From May 18, until now (June 12), I've been in agony. The muscle spasms are relentless. This time it feels like they are trying to crush my rib cage and rip themselves free from where they attach in my back. Nothing fazes them. Lortab 7.5 750 helps some, but I can't take the stuff 4 times a day, and I still feel worse, even on Lortab, than I did before starting Savella. I'm weening myself off of it starting immediately. Of course, anyone reading this who has fibromyalgia knows that the disease itself my be the culprit. That's how fibromyalgia works. We may do pretty well for a time, then it grabs us and slaps us down. Time to suffer for a while. That's what makes it so hard to find something that helps. We never know what is causing our present condition, be it good or be it bad. After suffering like this for over 25 years, one would think that I would know better than to start thinking something might help. Thankfully, 20 mg of Flexeril still knocks me out for 6 hours so I get to sleep some.

column2: girl with fibromyalgia, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with fibromyalgia a couple yrs ago and i was taking cymbalta for depression already. So apparently, that wasnt working for me cuz I was always in pain, couldnt get out of bed, couldnt make it to restroom in time, couldnt hardly even walk. I was then put on Lyrica.  I had an allergic reaction to it so the doctor then put me on Gabepentin and that did nothing at all for me. NOTHING!! except weight gain. I finally found out from another doctor that savella was a med for fibro but it wasnt put on the market at that time or fda approved for fibro.  I started taking savella and about a week or so of taking it, it was a miracle drug for me.  I was able to walk up and down the stairs, do every thing i couldnt do.  I was simply amazed and so happy that this dr. put me on it.  I couldnt believe at the difference it made. It was like I had no legs and then woke up to legs. It was god sent. I was even able to go back to work, brush my hair, lift my drink, get out of the bed by myself, I could go on and on at the things I couldnt do.  Thank god for Savella, that's all I got to say about it cause it was definately the med for me.

column9: During the first 3-4 days this medication helped increase my energy level somewhat.  Then the profuse sweating, worsening palpitations and nausea/vomiting/abdominal pain set in. I experienced red burning facial discomfort and felt feverish.  My skin, however, was cold & clammy with goosebump appearance.  I have tried so many different medications: Neurontin, Lyrica, Cymbalta, and seemingly countless antidepressants, muscle relaxers, pain killers, etc.  All were tried with high hopes of "this has to be the one" just to be disappointed...again.  I am a Registered Nurse forced to retire early due to this terrible condition. I KNOW there has to be something out there that will help.  Still searching for the right medication and/or combination.  Please be careful when trying this medication.  I hope it works for you.  I have been off of it for over 5 days now and am still experiencing gastritis symptoms.

column9: I was on Savella For 7 months for Fibomyalgia (dianosed 12+ years ago)after not tolerating Lyrica (too sedating) or Cymbalta (muscle/leg pain). After experiencing significant nausea for several weeks, the pain/fatigue significantly improved for months.  The problem I encountered involved my migraines...I had a significant increase in numer and severity, with no apparent cause.  Until the only possible thing I could try-I went off Savella.  The withdrawal, even though I went off it VERY slowly, was miserable, but the migraine I had suffered for several weeks went away.  The headaches became much more manageable and less severe. My neurologist concluded that the Savella had been the new "trigger" for the migraines.Savella was great for the fibro, but was terrible to "go off", a trigger for my migraines, and I have felt poorly since I went off it 5 months ago.

France had it 10 years before we did.I had this severe pain for 39 years. 20 years of being prescribed a steady regimen of narcotic pain meedicine caused me to now have clinical depression. It took six years of hospitalization to get that under control/ I had 4 surgeries, all injections known to neurologists, most who think they're God.I wish the people at the FDA could suffer like those of us who always have to wait on them-it's not just safety that slows down the process9As if we didn't know).

column9: I have been taking Savella for 3 months now and my pain is gone!  I feel like my old self again.  It wasn't without problems though.  The side effects were horrible.  I had rapid heart rate, very bad anxiety, and nausea.  I went to my doctor and he said since my pain was gone, we needed to temporarily treat the side effects.  He put me on ativan for the anxiety, zofran for nausea, along with a mild beta blocker to slow down my heart rate.  Once he did that, it was like a light switch came one and I felt 100% better.  I am now beginning to reduce these the medicines for the side effects as they are beginning to subside.  With Savella, I have also been able to stop taking Ultram and Zanaflex.  I am completely satisfied.

column9: My doctor gave the pack to use after tappering down from Lexapro.  Soon as the dose got to 50mg and then jumped to 2 times 50 per day, I have had nothing but side effects.  Resting blood pressure 150/100 and my face has felt like it has been burning up even though I have no fever.  I get light headed, cannot deal with any type whatsoever of stress as the side effects get even worse.  My ears have been burning, constipation, extreme thrist but not urinating as much I think I should since I been drinking more water.  I don't think I can deal with this med.  Yeah, some of the muscle aches have gone away but I think pain meds work better with more tolerable side effects.  I called my DR. and of course she was gone for the day, so I got 2 different associates, the last one told me I had to keep taking the 50 mg till I could see my dr on Monday, I can't...see myself doing that with the way I am feeling today, since when I missed the dose yesterday, I felt better this morning and didn't feel bad again till after I took another dose on Dr.s orders. I say take at your own risk but maybe if you are already on HP meds tell the Doc, NO THanks.  Also read that there is letter from patients to the FDA to pull the drug back off the market as it was approved too fast. http://www.drugs.com/news/group-urges-recall-fibr omyalgia-22134.html

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Jamie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed Savella for treatment of Fibromyalgia, and to help me wean off Lyrica, (severe withdrawals on my first attempt). With the 2-week starter pack, I was told to "stop immediately" yesterday after only 6 days. Side effects: severe nausea/abdominal pain, chest pain/tightness, severe headache/pressure, severe muscle pain/burning, leg cramps, chills, sore throat, stiff neck, irritability, anxiety, weakness, insomnia, coordination problems, eye pain. I feel terrible. The side effects are much worse than I could have anticipated.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: grammyd, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I actually wrote a review about three months ago, but want to update it.  I've now been on Savella for about 5 months, but was diagnosed with fibro almost 20 years ago.  I am still amazed at the feeling of well-being I have had since on Savella.  My pain and stiffness is virtually gone.  I still take Savella on a full stomach so I don't get nausea.  I am still sweating, which for me is one of the worst side effects, but I do think that's getting better.  I have gotten rid of all my sweaters, that's for sure!  I also have freezing cold hands and feet - I feel like all the heat is directed to my face, head, and neck, leaving no heat for my hands.  I think I am most surprised that my thinking is almost 100% clearer!  I can concentrate on tasks and actually finish one before I start another.  The fibrofog is gone!  Another side effect I've noticed is my skin feels and looks like I have goosebumps all the time.  I still have tingling in my scalp, but I'm wondering if anyone else has this skin thing?  My constipation is much better - I eat 1 Activia yogurt a day and it helps.  My heart rate is faster, but my BP is stable.  My pain/burning/tingling comes back only if I am over-tired.  After reading all the comments I realize why it's so hard for drug companies to figure out if drugs work.  Look at how many of us have such different reactions!  I can understand that some of you want this taken off the market because you feel the side effects are so dangerous, but for those of us for whom it works, I thank God every day for this drug!  I wish it worked this well for everyone. Good luck to all of you - something will come along that will help you - hopefully soon!

column2: &quot;J&quot;, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Initially, I had significant problems with nausea. Due to the severity of my fibromyagia, I kept taking it as I experienced symptom improvement with fatigue, overall pain, and stamina.  After 4-5 months, I noticed an increase in the frequency of migraine headaches.  At 6 months, I had a severe migraine for 3 weeks, and was hospitalized.  I couldn't resolve the headache, and finally started looking at all of the side effects to all medications I was on.  As a last resort, I titrated off the Savella.  Migraine is gone-frequency of headaches is way back down.  As a migraine sufferer, I couldn't tolerate Savella-but it decreased many of the fibro symptoms I had while I was on it.  The nausea was always a minor problem-but if you can get through the first few weeks-it gets much better! Monitor headaches closely if you have migraines! What a huge disappointment that I had to stop it!  I didn't even realize how much it was helping until I went off it. Now my pain level is unbelievable (high)!  Just thought I would pass on my experience...good luck and hang in there!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: dansbeloved, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had FM for 2 years and recently the trigger point,deep tissue pain has been worse than ever, especially as the day wears on. Nortriptylin has always controlled the pins and needles and more minor aches, and Topamax the migraines. Not now. Dr decided to try Savella. So far the pain is 50 to 70% better and only dry mouth as a side effect. I did NOT like that the starter package incert did not include a list of known side effects to look for, only the standard drug company(CYA)"anti-suicide" warning required on all anti-depressants. I take beta-blockers for a rapid heart rate, so you have all been helpful to red flag that. Thanks. Also the BP. I hope you all report everything to the FDA via the helpful number provided below. Maybe then newbees will be made more aware, and some with serious risks told to steer clear. Thanks for sharing.

From time to time my forehead will get really warm and I will start to sweat. I also have night sweats. As much as I sweat becasue of it I can not see how I would ever gain weight taking it.

column1: Other
column2: frnchangel4u, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed this for fibromyalgia and at first it seemed like a wonder drug.  My mood lifted and the pain diminished by about 70 percent.  It didnt do anything for my energy level or sleepless nights but I wanted to give it at least 2 months to fully work.  I was taking 100mg a day but after 2 months I noticed that about an hour after taking them I lost all concept of time and just didnt care about doing anything.  I knew I had things to do but it was like the day wasnt going to end and I would get to it.  I never did.  I was usually in the same clothes in the evening that I wore in the morning and didnt even care to shower.  I didnt want to do anything.  The sweats got worse and worse and were non stop.  It took me awhile to relate my feelings with this pill until I forgot to take it one morning and I felt normal.   I then started skipping my evening dose and I really noticed the difference.  The fog went away at night.  I told my Doctor today I want to wean off of it and he prescribed me tramadol.  To me the pain relief was not worth the mental fog and laziness/sweats that the savella caused.  I can deal with pain better than dealing with feeling out of my head.  Its sad because I heard such good things about this drug.  Everyone is different though, give it a try, it may work for you.

column9: Started Savella in Sept 09, 12.5mg/day. Had been on Cymbalta with little results, switced to Savella due to constant nausea. I now take 150mg/day of Savella. The Wellbrutrin works for depression but has done nothing for me pain.  In fact my pain is much worse than when I was on the Savella.  I had fibromyalgia, which returned after my car accident.  Before the accident, I was using a natural juice containing the acai berry and 18 other fruits and all my symptoms went away and I felt awesome for the first time in years.  My traumatic accident seems to have set off the fibromyalgia agian.  Now, the fruit juice doesn't seem to working.  Not sure if I will go back on the Savella because I don't know if the twitching will become permanent.  I notice no other side effects with Savella.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Happier Girl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I started out on this medication 11 months ago.  At that time I was walking everywhere with a cane. I have degenerative disk disease, Fibromilgia, and arthritis.  I felt as though my life was on a down hill slide.  I had tried every other fibromialgia drug with no success.  This was my last resort.  I had the same problems in the beginning as several other people and was ready to give up.  My doctor suggested to crush the pills and try it in small doses several times a day until I felt as though I was adjusting to it.  It took about 3 weeks and then I was able to take the pill in small pieces as I adjusted to the medication.  I am happy to say I rarely need the cane and am 90% pain free. I have more energy, and a much happier outlook.  Please give this medicine a chance.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Within 3 days of beginning this new drug I felt like a new person. I arose from bed, went to the bathroom, did my business, then upon walking out realized how easy I just walked. It was like a miracle, no joke. I thought I was going crazy. I decided it must be a fluke or something. No medicine works that fast, or that effectively. Throughtout the day, I continued to notice the ease with which I was performing tasks of all nature, so I called and requested a visit with my rheumatologist for that week. I went in, explained to him and shared my worries of maybe it just being "psychosematic" and he laughed. It's not in your head, it's in your body. This drug really worked that fast! He shared that several of his patients had reacted to this med just as quickly and were having as good of results as I was. I have never had such good reslts from anything before and the side effects for me were just icing on the cake. I lost 20 pounds in the first month, gained so much energy, I'm more alert, and happier than I've been in years. I am only 44 and felt like I was older than my mother. Now I can swim and actually keep up with my 7 year old daughter.

column2: penelopeq, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been taking it for several months now. It took a while to get used to. It was better than Cymbalta. At first I had nausea, excessive sweating, and dizzeness. But, I started sleeping better after YEARS of not sleeping well. The dr. took me off all anti-inflamatorys, sleeping meds and muscle relaxers I had been on for years, and I thought the doc was crazy for doing this. But, my son who has the same dr. told me to trust him & I did. Now after months, the pain is much less, only my oesteo arthritis pain remains, I am less nauseated, hardly ever sweaty. I take 2 50mg a day and divide the dose into 4 times with food.  That helped a LOT. My dr. also put me on NO exercise for a month. I again, thought he was crazy, but it worked and my muscles healed. Now I can do a little more and more each day. Hang in there folks, it does get better. For me the alternative medicines are much, much, worse. Good luck everybody.

Shooting pains down my legs into my feet. I wake up with my left shoulder, arm and hand deformed and quivering - hubby says looks like nerves. I agree with others here, I'd rather have the original pain.

column1: Other
column2: feeling better in GA, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Nausea, headache; they go away after awhile. Itchy skin was the most bothersome. To others trying this, don't give up. The side effects were over-whelming at first. My doctor decided to start me at an extreme low dose for thirty days, and up in increments of twenty-five mg's every thirty days. Much easier to adjust.  After eleven years, this is the first med to help me with a chronic pain problem. Ask your doctor for meds to combat the initial side effects and try to continue taking the medicine. I have been to countless pain clinics, neurologists, spine centers and  much more. I've lost count of how many meds I tried that I could not take because of the side effects, or they just plain didn't work for me. This one works. I have less pain and generally feel better about life.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles

column9: I was diagnosed with FM a week ago. But have had degenerative disc disease, severe never damage and ostiopenia for over a year now. I hope the best for everyone, just remember, we are not alone!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: RosieFeats, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: All reviewers have physical conditions unique to them that include other meds, life situations, ages, etc. All can and do effect ANY med's results. That said, stopping Cymbalta and starting Savella has been wonderfully effective for me, very nearly miraculous, after 5 weeks of use. Suggestions: take w/food; take dose 2 no later than 3 p.m.; give it a chance to work, i.e., longer than a week). Because I take a number of other meds for pain management not associated with Fibro (retired on disability at age 46 due to genetic spinal disease/6 surgeries; 2 hip replacements; etc.), the only side effect I could discern to be associated with Savella was dizziness (gone). I am energized, my pain level is way down, I am more ME again than I have been in years. Family and friends are astounded. Am I painfree? No. But do I expect to be? NO. It has taken me years to get to this mind set and believe me, there are times I slide into "why me." Time will tell whether Savella helps me to continue to feel so much better! Wishes for good and better days to all!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: gran, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had to discontinue the use of Lyrica due to developing a late in life allergy to sulfa (Lyrica is sulfa based - one has to read the fine, fine print to determine that fact).  The Lyrica was prescribed in a pain management program; the relief from FM was an added bonus which was sorely missed when i was forced to discontinue.  Hoped that Savella would be as helpful, NOT!! Headaches, sweats - both hot and cold, vomiting and severe stomach pain were experience within 12 hours of the first small dose... i wonder how some medications receive FDA approval when so many of us have such severe reactions... am back to square one... ugh!!

I stopped taking this and my body is killing me again.  I don't know what to do.  I called my doctor and was told that I was fine before and asked if I would rather put up with the "mild" side-effects or hurt again.  I was also told that they never heard anyone complaining about mood-swings.  Does anyone else have this?
