column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: ladyamity, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication was prescribed for fibromyalgia pain. The side effects of terrible agitation, poor concentration due to feeling "rushed" anxious,anorexia,loss of taste, and an almost uncontrollable agitation far outweigh any of its intended benefit. I still have headaches and they seem worse because I am unable to sleep due to a racing mind from this medication. I am an APN, and I would not recommend this medication for fibromyalgia w/o thoroughly reviewing the terrible side effects. I trialed this medication for a full month and now need to see my physician to effectively wean off. I am not 25, I am 56 and the feelings of agitation and poor appetite  and suicidal ideation far outweigh any benefits this drug may promise. I would highly suggest further drug trials and studies be done. The FDA needs to be made aware of this potentially highly dangerous medication.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: pillhater, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Started on Savella 2 months. Had just stopped taking Zoloft a week and went to Dr for pain and he gave me Savella. Since 01/2006 lots of tests for chronic nausea, mri's, ultrasounds all negative & never diagnosed with fm. Sent to psychitrist given many depression meds until I said no longer. Can't tell yet if Savella has helped. Still nauseated, pain, terrible sweats & at 65 over menopause. Thirsty, no appetite. Seem to get a lot of UTI'S. Take Xanax & Lunesta to sleep. Mirolax was working great, but seems to have slowed since starting Savella. Seem to be more irritable. Hard to tell since have been going through this for four years. Seeing a new internal med dr this month that specializes in fm. My pcp doc doesn't really have a clue. Noticed a lot of reviews have shoulder pain. Mine started 2006 with a torn rotary cuff and went down hill from there. Two months ago started with plantar facisitis. Savella hasn't helped that, got supports & new tennies. Seem to have more headaches now. I will be checking out reviews for Lyrica & Cymbalta since these seem to be popular. Hate this, retired 08/2005 healthy, active and lots of plans. Depression meds really made situation worse. Really slowed me down and symptoms started compounding. Not what I visioned my retirement. Forgot to mention stress level really high. Will let you know what new doc says in Feb.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: gonielsen, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was very excited about trying Savella. I got the 4-wk titration pak and started taking it.  On the second night of taking 2 50 mg doses per day, I had the most severe headache, complete with flashes of light. Soon after, I felt like I had the worst case of flu ever. After a week I still have horrible nausea, headaches, dizziness, hot flashes, emotional, and feel like I won't be "around" much longer.  My hands and feet are freezing, but I feel hot and sweaty.  I am always angry, have brain fog.  My blood pressure shot up past 140/110 and my pulse is at 110! I am tapering off starting with the next dose. I would rather deal with the pain!!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: chill0009, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have tried many medicatios for my fibromyalgia over the years. My doctor seemed so hopeful because this one was supposed to work differently.  His enthusiam made me enthusiastic.  From the first day, I had headaches that began about 30 minutes after each dose.  By the time I had been on it a week, the headaches were pretty constant. After the first three days, I began to have problems sleeping.  Then the chest pains started.  My heart began beating extremely hard.  Not faster, it just seemed to be contracting harder. That was a scary feeling! I lasted nine days before I finally gave up. I was very disappointed but I would rather experience my usual muscle pain and exhaustion than deal with the side effects.

I am able to go home after work and not just lie around in my pj's with the heating pad. I have had weight gain also, but I attribute that to being less active, not because of the drug. I am so happy to be feeling "great"!!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Sharka, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I decided to wait until christmas was over before starting this med. because other reviews here made me abit scared I would get pretty sick. I am now on the fourth day and I have had no side effects what so ever. I think it ios starting to help with my pain some, but not where I can say a great improvement. I hope it starts helping soon. I am worried about weight gain, but so far no change in appetite either.Also was worried about not sleeping, so I took the advice of another reviewer here and I take the evening pill no later than 3pm. I sleep great. BUT, it has only been four days. My hope is that this med. will make a difference. I am so tired of laying on the couch in pain everyday, all day. Yesterday, I only laid down for 1 hour, so that was good. Since reading the negative side effects, I seem to catch myself waiting for something bad to happen. I stay positve about it though and so far so good. Good luck to all. I just hope next time I check in, I can tell you guys that this med. is a life saver for me.  Oh and I am taking up Yoga (in my living room). It will be hard, but I am going to try to fight this pain. Maybe the combonation of the two will improve me. I hope I don't have to high of hopes. I have been in severe pain for 10 years now, in and out of hospitals, fm,nerve damage,and OA.(other smaller things to.) This has to help or I will be stuck back in that dark hole that I'm sure you guys know very well.

column9: After being on savella for 3 months, I have taken my self off the med. column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: grammyd, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After 3 days on Savella, I walked normally downstairs in the morning for the first time in almost 20 years.  My morning stiffness is almost 100% better, and my other pain symptoms have all but disappeared unless I don't get enough sleep.  If I get overtired they will flare a little.  My thinking is also much clearer, and I have much more energy - fatigue is much less.  Side effects include tingling/burning of the scalp which has almost disappeared, and nausea unless I take it right after meals.  The most annoying side effect, but getting better is excessive, extreme sweating.  This may be worse because I was having hot flashes before the medication.  Wish this worked as well for everyone.  For me, it's miraculous!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: trumpetmom1, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This is my second attempt to take Savella.  This first time I stayed on 12.5mg once daily with supper, but wanted to eat constantly, gained weight, I also had mild hot flashes but wasn't sure this had caused it.  I stopped on my own.  Then I noticed no more hot flashes,but my body was wracked with pain and my arm/shoulder area were in pain and had limited range of motion.  The Dr. put me on this again, thinking I need to try 12.5mg twice daily for 2 wks, then go up to 25mg twice daily for 2wks.  I haven't gotten there yet.  This time I have nausea about a hour or so after eating, no hot flashes have reappeared yet...so far I'm not hungry like before...but have noticed I'm feeling frustrated with people around me....I already talk wellbutrin for depression.  Will post more after a couple of weeks.....I'm sure this crazy winter weather is not helping my situation.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: MimiPatty, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have FM and the multiple locations and frequency of my pain is very difficult to monitor as a pattern.  This drug has helped me have more good days then bad. The first think I noticed was the clarity of my thinking, second was the fluidity of body movement returning.  I recommend this drug to anyone who has chronic pain in multiple locations, stiffness in neck, joints...

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: clarity2012, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Dx'd with FM 1998.  I've been on Savella a little over a month.  I didn't think I was going to be able to continue due to the nausea, stomach cramps.  After some self education & reading these reviews, possibly taking it on a empty tummy is easing the tummy issues.  Pain is much better, energy seems to be better.  Very thirsty, drinking more water.  Blurred vision due to dry eyes, artificial tears improve dryness & vion. Only sleeping approx. 4 hours at night.  But if I continue with improved pain & energy, YAEH FOR ME !  My doc was always OK with me trying the latest FM meds.  Before Savella, Wellbutrin (for pain & energy) & Amitriptyline (for sleep & pain) was the VERY best out of all the FM meds I had tried throughout the years.  Always went back to that combo.  After another month or 2, I will give another review.  Here's to a pain free 2010 for us all !

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: got.my.life.back, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: After two years of horrible unexplainable pain I was diagnosed with fibromyalgia. I hurt everywhere and was tested for everything and it all came back negative. Even my skin hurt to be touched. This med has given me back my life. I had the nausea and hot flashes in the beginning. As for the nausea, I learned when to take it and what foods to avoid. For me, waiting one hour after a meal was the best way to avoid the nausea. I still experience the hot flashes but they are a small price to pay in exchange for pain relief! When I returned to my doctor for followup, he was thrilled when I told him I could kiss him. This medication has made such a difference in my life.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Joanna, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had Fibromyalgia since 1997!Long before even a Doctor could help me. So now everyone knows its a real illness, but there is very little help. Savella was given to me along with Lyrica. I felt like i haven't felt in yrs. But the sweating and heavy feeling in my chest scared me. I stopped Savella a few days ago and the chest pain is gone. I'm not taking that risk! Bu tit might not have this affect on someone else. Fibromyalgia is a very difficult thing to deal with and treat. My thoughts are you should give it a try. Any Rx that has to be gradually introduced in to the body, has a risk of being very dangerous later on.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: inthesticks30, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medicine made me feel worse than when I had the flu.  It made my head pound so bad I was stuck on the couch for two days.  It didn't suprise me though I've tried all of this type of medicine and it all has made my head hurt or feel like there was a blender in my brain, or affects my chest making it feel like my heart is doing sommersaults.  I have been diagnosed with Sjorgens Syndrome recently and I'm hoping the docs can find something soon.  I hope this helps someone, I have looked for 15+ years for what is wrong with me and finally I think I got the right diagnosis.  It takes time, occasionally half your life.

column1: Other
column2: chefhall, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Finally Pain Free!!!!! First time in years.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Lucky20, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have had fibromyalgia before it as even recognized by the medical community. I was called a pill seeker, when all I needed was relief. Thanks to products such as Lyrica, people are now recognizing the symptoms and disease. I guess it takes a TV commercial for the public to be informed. I now have a wonderful doctor I have been seeing for five years now, who put me on Savella six months ago.He told me I have the worst case of fibro that he has ever seen because it went untreated for so long. He did tell me there's only a 50/50 chance the Savella will help me. The side effects were horrible at first, but it was helping my pain, so I was determined to get though it. The nausea went away after two months, but the excessive sweating never stopped. By the time I got to work, I looked like I got stuck in a rain storm. The night sweats also got worse and the pain returned.I couldn't take it any more. I am gradually cutting down on this medicine so I can go back to taking Celebrex and will never take Savella again. The Celebrex helped me more than the Savella and am willing to risk it's side effects, than the side effects I experienced with Savella. I do hope it does help some people. The drug administration needs to work on the side effects, such as the excessive sweating. Good luck to all of you with this horrible illness. Maybe, with all of the media exposure, they can perfect a medication just for us with less side effects. I would not wish this illness on anyone.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: lynninheaven, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: On med. for 3 mo. Initially found myself feeling energetic upon rising in am & was more flexible w movement.  Noticed itching & hoped it would cease.  Also began noticing extreme perspiration on some days, not all.  Itching still occurs after taking 2nd dose at end of day.  Perspiration problem has worsened.  Take Benedryl to ease itching @ HS. Notice that stiffness & sorness in body is returning.  Afraid I'm not having the success I was initially so exited about.Excessive Perspiration a real problem.Have reduced amt. of sleep aids, no wt gain. Keep hoping side effects will lessen c time, but concerned that

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: False Logic, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started this med several months ago. My body had a horrible time getting used to it, it aggravated my existing acid reflux to the point that I would vomit 30 mins after I took it every time. However, I stuck with it, learned what to eat with it, take gaviscon with it and now don't vomit at all. The misery was worth it! My life has been at a halt with fibro, I can't function. For the first time in years though, things are starting to slowly change. The longer I take the medicine, the better it is starting to work. The best for me is that the fibro 'fog' has lessened, and that was always very tough for me. I shake with my fibro as well and with the savella that is starting to lessen, which is thrilling to me because I am an artist and haven't been able to draw for five years because of fibro. I recommend to anyone who is going to try this, even if you are miserable on it at first, stick with it for at least six weeks. A short amount of misery is worth the possibilty of this helping the rest of your life be better.

column1: Other
column2: Ladyrose1950, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Savella with titration pack on October 20, 2009. I really had no annoying side effects. My pain has disappeared in many parts of my body, mainly my right leg bothers me but I also have Osteoarthritis of hips and knees. My pain med usage has cut drastically from FM pain.

column9: I have been on it for a month.  I had to stop it! I got 2 or 3 hrs a night of broken sleep, I started to cry all the time for n serious reason. I went through the day before and Thanksgiving wanting to ill myself. I have never experienced anything like this in my life. I would rather have pain and depression then total suicidal thoughts and so close to action in those thoughts.  I lost weight but who cares about weight if you are that bad feeling and I wondered why my head etched so much. It drove me nuts!  Please be so careful using this medication.  I feel a lot better since I have been off it just 4 days. Not totally back but much better!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Savella for almost two months. During that time, I've only had 2 days of pain. I have had side effects like itchy scalp, trouble sleeping, constipation, hot flashes, nausea, etc. These seem to be getting better with time.  I have lost almost 20 pounds since starting the medicine mainly due to a decreased appetite.  I have no interest in food so I have to make sure what I do eat is good for me. It is worth it to tough it out through the side effects.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles

column9: I took the first pill 12.5 mg around 4 in the afternoon and by supper time my elbow pain was gone.I have been on it almost a week and have seen amazing difference in my pain and energy.The only side effects I've had is mild headache,head itching and broken sleep.Hoping these will subside as time goes by.But if they don't well worth standing on Savella.Thank God for this medicine!I feel more like myself then I have in 8 years.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles

I did and I had to quit taking the meds because I feared I was going to hurt someone or myself.  However it did lessen my pain while I was on it.  So if your thinking about trying it,  I would say at least try it.  I have read the other comments about how much it helped people and if it can work for you with no or minor side effects, go for it.  I would have kept it up if I could have safely done so.  Would be nice to be able to function again.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Debi, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with Fibro, and subsequently Systemic Lupus, 14 years ago.  This medication has changed my life.  I am now pain free, energetic and just overall so much better.  Believe me, in the years I have had FM, I have tried everything.  Even flew to Maryland to see Dr. Titlebaum who wrote "From Fatique to Fantastic."  Nothing has made a difference like this medication.  I had no side effects when I began taking the medication.  My physician said that 50% of patients would have some of the side effects that have been mentioned in others blogs.  I was fortunate to not have these.  If you do have the side effects, I believe that what the medication can do for you ultimately is worth adjusting, or giving your body time to adjust to the medication.  It's awesome and has changed my life in such a positive way.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Mhinkle, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I started on Savella several months ago. After getting off Cymbalta due to the migranes it gave me. I had no side effects while titrating up, or after being on it for some time.  It is very effective in decreasing my pain/stiffness.  My energy is increased and I can do so much more now.  Before I could barely get through my day at work, I would come home and be exhausted. Now I have energy to exercise everyday, this helps to decrease my pain greatly.  I still have bad days, when I have to take a volteran also.  But mostly I am very happy with this medication.  I did go back for a check up after three months of being on Savella, and my cholesterol was EXTREMLY elevated.  She said it was a side effect of this medication.  I was already eating well and exercising to lower my cholesterol, and it was coming down before I started Savella.  I go back for a recheck, but I'm not sure if it will stay elevated.  I'm not sure if anyone else has this problem.  It is the only one I have with this medicine.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: cowgirl, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this for about 5 months.  I am very happy with the results.  I have only taken 25mg a day instead of the 50mg, however, it is helping with the pain and also I seem to have more energy.  Also, I haven't gained weight like I did on Lyrica or Cymbalta!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: nik28, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was just diagnosed and was given the 4 week titration pack. This is the only drug I have taken for fibro and Im not on any other medication. At first the side effects were pretty bad, nausea, sweating, chills, my face would flush and turn bright red. However, now that Im on the third week the side effects have decreased. I hardly get as flushed and hot as I used to. I take my doses (two 50mg a day) one in the morning, about 7am and the other about 5pm. Taking the night dose early in the evening keeps me from staying up, I can hardly stay awake past 9pm now. Although I havent noticed a decrease in my pain level yet, my energy level has increased and Im finally starting to sleep through the night. I no longer have brain fog and dont feel like I need a nap at the end of the day. My doc had explained to me that Savella is better for treating the fibro fatigue while Lyrica is better for the pain. To not feel like total crap at the end of the day and getting a full nights sleep has been wonderful. I suggest that anyone on this drug stick it out past the side effects, its does get better.

column1: Other
column2: BILLY_MCKENZIE@BELLSOUTH.NET, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Fighting FMS and depression for over 16 years. For the past year,getting worse instead of better. Just been put on new medication called SAVELLA.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: momsmess, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Fibromyagia Network had an excellent story on this medication in Oct.09 issue. A must read for all who want to play the guinea pig. On second week now, pain and burn decreasing, appetite is nil, but that was a problem before. Energy level is up by maybe a third. Sweating, insomnia and nausea the primary issues. Hoping these can be managed by  careful dosage adjustments and very slow titration. 50mg seems to to be the tipping point for nausea early on. Try night dose 6 hours before bed to help with sleep. Sweating/hot flashes are really bad. I'm willing to tough this med out as it has potential to help those of us that have had FMS for a long time. Maybe the newly diagnosed with obtain a better quality life much earlier than I have. FMS/MPS since 1988. If its been made, I've tried it!

I am now depressed and cry for no reason,  I was not before starting the meds. I have no appetite at all, my family keeps trying to make me eat, but I have no interest in even trying.  My eyes are blurry and so far I have fallen twice from the dizziness.  So now I am in more pain than when I started taking it.  Has anyone else found it hard to even look at food since taking this? column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Was diagnosed in July of this year with Fibromyalgia & Ankylosing Spondylitis.  Began taking Savella 50mg twice a day & Lyrica 100mg am & 200 mg pm in July, along with anti-inflammatory meds.  At first, felt very irritable, along with being sweaty almost constantly, including my face - which is not normal for me.  Now, 4 months later, most of the side effects have subsided, still sweat more than is normal for me, but the irritability and depression is gone.  I am also on Ryzolt, Lyrica 300mg at night, Voltaren & Sulfasalzine.  Hard to tell since I am on so many meds which are the ones helping the most, although at this time, I prefer to take the Savella in the morning and no lyrica, as that was making me too tired.  I think overall I'm satisfied with Savella, but did take a few months for the side effects to subside.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: cgradylv, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on Savella for almost a month now, and have experienced extreme dizziness, nausea and sweating. My fibromyalgia pain and pain from my disk degenerative disease is a little better, but I hope that as I continue on the medication my pain level will keep decreasing. I have not not experienced any loss of appetite, in fact I seem to be eating more...especially sweets.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: SweetPea, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had fibromyalgia and chronic fatigue syndrome since 1990.  The only med that helped was Mobic. When I first started the titration pack of Savella I felt less overall pain, with the muscles in the bottoms of my feet feeling less painful.  I also felt more clearheaded.I still have a headache in the morning, and wake up sweating like a pig.  I sweat at every change in temperature or exertion, from my scalp to my feet, while my hands are like ice.  My make-up slides off my face and my hair goes limp and stinks, as does my body.  Savella must affect the hypothalamus or whatever controls body temperature.I continued taking 50mg 2x per day but found myself getting depressed and not doing the things I wanted to do and the things I needed to do.I still sleep only 4 hours and can only be on my feet for 4 hours without having to lie down.  This is no improvement over the Mobic, which is much cheaper.I am disappointed because I had heard of this drug before the FDA approved it and thought the drug companies would have eliminated, or at least reduced, the negative side effects, since it has been on the market in Europe for over 5 years.I hope it works for other people, but I am tapering off as I type.  There has to be a better product to be developed.Good luck to you.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: stinkyboogar, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: well i have been on savella for almost a month im up to 150 mg of it. i'am not sure  what to think of it yet i'm just getting over  the flu and i hurt like i never knew i could! plus i took a nasty fall on halloween, i told the dr that i dont think this drug is helping but since i was sick and have taken a nasty fall and just started savella he wants me to stay on it for the next month (it will give the 150 mgs time to work too) but its really not taking any of my pain away the cymbaltia seemed to work better so far.as for the side effects most of them do go away. i just have hot flashes but i think its some of the other meds im taking to get over  this nasty flu!

column1: Other
column2: ginnyj182, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Not at this time.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Fibro-free, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have suffered from fibromyalia for over 30 years. I went through the early stages of doctors telling me it was all in my mind, so I dealt with the pain. Thankfully doctors are now recognizing that this is a true disorder and not just a "mental" issue. It took several yrs before I would discuss this problem again with my dr as I had been made felt that it was "my" mental problem. I tried Lyrica and could not deal with the wt. gain, then Savella came out and I started on 2 50mg twice a day which had to be increased to 100mg 2 x day. I had almost given up when it finaly started working after about 2 wks on the increased dose! Finally, no more pain!!! I never had side effects. I was a bit disappointed that I had to read about 25 comments before I finally saw the positive reports on this review on exactly how wonderful this drug is. So thankful that I did not have the side effects others did. If I had read these reviews before taking Savella, I'm not sure I would have even tried it with the negative side effects that were reported. It has been a miracle for me!!

The only problem I have is the expense is outrageous.

Every person is different in their response to meds so one should be very cautios when taking ANY medication and do their research.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles

column9: I have suffered with severe pain of fibromyalgia for 10 years!!! After taking Savella only one week, I FEEL LIKE A NEW PERSON. I have energy and feel normal in my body and that heaviness and depressed feeling that goes with chronic pain is gone! This is the best drug ever. I was so use to running to doctors and trying to get stronger medicines, even narcotics did not totally releive my pain. Thank God for Savella. It is truly a miracle drug. I feel like a normal person for the first time in years!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

column1: Other
column2: GLENDA, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I HAVE BEEN TAKING SAVELLA FOR ABOUT 2 MONTHS FOR FIBRO PAIN AND I FILL THAT IT HAS BEEN MANAGING MY PAIN ALOT BETTER, I AM STILL ON THE LYRICA TOO, THOUGH.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: 45-54 Female  (Patient)
column9: This is the first med that has worked for me for my fibromyalgia. I have a clear mind again, energy, stamina and reduced pain. The side effects of nausea, sweating and jitteriness wore off after about 2 weeks. I started the titration pac and currently take 25 mg in the morning and 12.5 in the evening. Occasionally I experience a rapid heart rate and my BP is higher than normal. I feel like I have my life back and can be fairly "normal' again. It has been over 13 years since I've been able to say that.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Savella is the first and only treatment that has worked on my fibromyalgia!!  I have tried Lyrica & Cymbalta previously.  Lyrica made me so dizzy I was walking into walls and vomiting.  Cymbalta made me feel like I had the flu!!  I was chilled and had stomach queeziness!!  The only side effect from Savella was my scalp itched for a few weeks!!  It works!  I have so little fibro pain anymore; it's a blessing!!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: dazigrrl, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I hadda quit taking Savella.  I was miserable.  I was on it for 4 months.  Side effect weren't bad at 1st then....The sweating was actually embarrassing,it was so bad.  I was covered in bruises for over a month (same bruises that didn't go away).  I had trouble peeing.  Constipation was, at times, unbearable.  My shoulder & neck muscles felt like they were on fire.  I had 24/7 "tension" headaches.  My migraine meds (for when I get one) didn't work.  I couldn't "focus"/concentrate...always felt like I was running in circles...scatterbrained (which cost me a new job, cuz I just wasn't "catching on").  The only positive thing was that it completely wiped out my appetite & I lost 38lbs...now let's see if I can keep it off...appetite hasn't reappeared yet (cross yer fingers).  I tapered my dose to 1/2 for abt 1 1/2 weeks, then stopped.  Caused a little nausea...other than that, doin ok.  Within 2 days of stopping, no more headache, shoulder & neck muscles somewhat loosened up (prob take a massage to get it back to normal), MUCH more clearheaded (not so..."chicken w/my head cut off"), rest of the stuff easing towards normal.  Been 1week now.  I go back to the prescribing doc tomorrow...yes, I quit w/o telling him 1st cuz I couldn't get in before my already scheduled appt.  So I planned it to be off abt 1week when I saw him again so I could see if things were better & let him know & go from there.

So I planned it to be off abt 1week when I saw him again so I could see if things were better & let him know & go from there.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Lee, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Overall Savella did help me enormously with my fibro symptoms more than any other medicine I have been a guinea pig for. But the side effects of this drug were to much and to dangerous for my body to bear. I have had fibromyalgia for 7 yrs. Was previously on Lyrica which was little help except to take away the flu like symptoms. My doctor decided to try me on Savella. I did the starter pack and worked up to the 50mg dose twice a day. Within one day a lot of the side effects hit me. I began suffering with headaches, chills and hot flashes, sweating profusely(so much so I was drinking tons of gatorade to keep up with the fluid loss),flushing, and I became irritable and hostile. I also got the decrease in appetite along with a bad case of constipation that required me to take stool softners,laxatives, and eat lots of fiber just to go. And when I did go it was so painful. The most drastic side effect was the increase in my heart rate and a massive increase in my blood pressure. Every week I was on this drug it kept rising til I was seen in the ER with a BP of 200/140. No joke. The ER doctor was scared I was going to stoke on him or have a heart attack. They injected me with blood pressure meds in my veins to get it back down and now I have to take blood pressure medicine til I am totally off Savella and my BP is back where it was before. My doctors and I have decided this drug is not worth the risks I have experienced. So now I am decreasing my dosage every week til I can get off this drug. The DT's are fun too. Trust me on that one. Hopefully I will feel more like myself again even if it means I am back to square one with just dealing with my Fibro symptoms on my own without these miracle drugs.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I almost finished the 2 week pack and I thought I was going off the deep end. I have fibro and suffer from constant pain. I was taking Prozac for several years and I feel the effect has worn off. My pain management doc encouraged this med. Wow! The side effects are terrible! I noticed it after the first week. I had terror dreams, increase heart rate, night leg cramps, brain fog, terrible sweating and blurred vision. I also had an emotional breakdown. I was crying at a drop of a hat. With all this I actual had a decrease in pain but could not tolerate the side effects. It just is not worth it.

I experienced the hot flushes and excessive sweating on day 2.  I am also in menopause so some of that may be due to it but it is worse than before.  Doctor had me go to just 1 50mg tab/day to see if they improve.  They seem to be a little less but I can deal with that if I'm pain free.  I've also noticed the dreaming but it's not bad. I'm anxious to see what happens when the epidural wears off to see if the savella is working or not.  Doctor said I can go back to trying 2 a day to see what happens.  Was on tramadol for a while and it quit working after a while as did naproxen. Just hoping this works for me cuz the pain was unbearable at times, not in my back so much as in my hip.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Goats Wifey, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had head, neck, shoulder, back and hip pain for the past 10 years. I had wiplash 3 times in 3 years in 99. I have been misserable! I also have severe anxiety, have been on 120mg of Cymbalta for 3 years, plus Buspar and Xanax. I also take a med for fast heart rate and was takin Vicodin for pain. In order to start the Savella I had to ween off of the Cymbalta due to Serotonin Syndrome! Since going off my Cymbalta and starting the Savella I feel as though I have completely lost my mind! I feel like crap, no energy and several anxiety attacks a DAY! When I use to only have the attacks a couple times a week! Just over a week ago I brought up the fact that I had done some research on Fibromyalgia and was wondering if this could be my problem. That is when he decided to try the Savella! I'm going to see my Dr tomorrow and I'm hoping that he can help me because I can't stand this feeling of wanting to stay in bed and not do anything but lay there in pain and cry!

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: minou9, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been on Cymbalta (60 mg) a year now for fibromyalgia and it worked pretty well except for constant fatigue. My doctor then switched me to Savella (titration pkg). I took that for a week and felt absolutely wonderful; no jitters, no sweating, and best of all...fatigue was gone. However, on day 7, I experienced a mild anxiety attack (which I get on occasion). My heart rate would speed up a bit and then it would pass. However this time it didn't; my heart started to race, I wasn't getting oxygen circulating, my face, hands & arms started to feel icy cold, I had difficulty speaking and moving. My husband took me to ER where they clocked my heart at 210 beats per minute. I was released within a few hours, no problems. I seem to recall that it was a seratonin issue. Needless to say, I stopped the Savella immediately and when I saw my doctor two days later, he put me back on Cymbalta. If I can resolve this anxiety attack issue, then I would love to give Savella another try.

column9: Wow! This is the first time I've had no pain in years. Lyrica turned me into a balloon. But Savella...I cried the first 3 days afraid it wouldn't work, cried the next 3 because it did. There is relief before you raise the dose from 12.5. It just gets better from there. It has worked best with NO food 2 hours before or after taking. It is not perfect. Some sleep would be nice but my pain was so bad anyway that Ambien gives me only 3-4 hours continuous sleep. I've lost 4 lbs in 2 weeks due to loss of appetite so make every calorie you injest a healthy one. This medication will get you off the sofa!!! If you've tried Cymbalta or Lyrica and have given up hope of ever having a life again, try one more time. Do it for your family. Do it for yourself.Your life is waiting.

I have been on every drug for Fibro for over 5 yrs. now I am feeling more human. The dry mouth led to me drinking more water & have not had constipation and also fixed the dry mouth. Be patient and above all tell your Dr. everything. Severe side effects right from the beginning: nausea that was unrelieved by anything I tried for it, headache, chills, hot flashes, crying jags, intense dreaming and constant awakening all night long, diahrreah, and to top it off, my migraine rescue meds seemed to stop working. I stayed on it for 4 days and ultimately decided that something that made me feel as bad as this did could not possibly be good for me. The pain and fatigue are easier to cope with than feeling so sick.    With chronic daily migraines and fibromyalgia, I have tried lots of different meds. Never have I experienced such intense misery from a medication! That said, I have to concede that Savella might be somebody else's salvation. We've all got to keep trying, right?

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: CARMEBEL, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I'm only on Savella for two weeks and after the first few days had to increase from one pill to two because I wasn't sleeping at all but still felt great immediately after starting this pill and had more energy than I've had in many years.  Once I upped to two pills I am now sleeping most of the night and have NO more numbness or tingling in arms, legs and Head.  I actually sleep pretty soundly most nights.  I noticed the head pain was the first to go almost immediately after me starting this pill.  It has worked wonders for me so far and just pray that it continues to make me feel GREAT and full of energy. I feel like Savella has given me my life back -- I now want to do things and don't feel tired or achy or have pain all over.  I was told by my neuro to gradually increase but I feel so good at just taking two I don't feel the need to increase it at this time.  I take them both before I go to bed at night and it seems to work for me.  I occassionally in the mornings get a little nauseous feeling but it goes away as fast as it comes.  I AM SO THANKFUL THAT I'VE FINALLY FOUND A PILL THAT ACTUALLY HELPS MY FIBROMYALGIA.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles

column9: I was given this drug for Fibromyalgia. It has been a blessing. I have been on for approximately 2 months and I am beginning to have a life again. Still have "bad days", but now they are just an occasional day - not several days in a row. I still take Tramadol on very painful days but overall I am extremely happy. I take 200mg of Savella a day. I actually am beginning to feel like exercising and my husband and kids say they can see a tremendous difference in me.

I have only taken the first 3 doses of the two week titration pack but I am going to stop taking it, get rid of the UTI and then wait and see what the specialist says when I see him. I'm already feeling really dizzy, ears are buzzing and I really just feel weird. Its 2am and I felt so weird when I tried to go to sleep. If I do try Savella again I will not take it in the evening with dinner, but with lunch instead. I took the first dose without food and felt nauseated, but then I took the other two with a decent meal and it wasn't as bad. My back definitely feels a little better already so I hope its just taking it with antibiotics that is making the side effects so annoying.

column9: I have had RA with Fibromyalgia for 3+ years.  With my doctors suggestion, I decided to try Savella because Lyrica has cause me to gain weight.  I am only on my second week, but the side effects are horrible.  I have profuse sweating and hot flashes, nausea, head aches, irritability  and just a feeling of being "out of it." The constipation is also bothersome. (I starting taking Miralax to counteract the constipation) I am curious if the side effects lessen as you continue the meds?  I do notice a slight increase in energy and less fb pain and weakness.  I will try to decide if it is worth dealing with these side effects in order to have more energy.  Perhaps this drug is not for everyone with my condition.  Possibly, it does not agree with my chemistry.  So far I am not too pleased, but I am willing to see if things improve.  I will discuss other options with my rheumatologist.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles

column9: I have had Fibromyalgia with CFS for 13+ years now, and so far, after 1 montgh of treatment I can tell a difference in pain level (decreased) and energy level.  My depression is actually worse, however, but that is because I was taken off of Lexapro, which has always been the most useful for my depression.  I just put this together this week, or made the connection. I'm pretty certain I can take them together as they act differently.Lyrica made me crazy, sleepy all the time, and Cymbalta did nothing.  I was hopeful, and am pleased so far.  Finally...a possible "cure", although I am not completely off pain meds, but think I will be within another month.I would highly recommend anyone who is diagnosed with FMS to try this medication, even if Cymbalta did not work.  They are similar but not identical.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: Gracie2001, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Like everyone else posting, I have fibromyalgia and I have run through Lyrica, Cymbalta, Ultracet, Flexeril, and various sleep meds. I am on week four of Savella. I do have more energy - jittery energy - and I do get up in the A.M. with less pain BUT - and this is a big "BUT": my heart rate and blood pressure are up (I take Verapamil and will probably have to increase it), the hot flashes then cold chills make sleep difficult so now I sleep in 90-minute cycles, I have a persistent headache and am horribly constipated. And really nauseated - the type which makes you pray to vomit. You all know what I mean. And the itchy scalp! (Thank heavens it is not just me!) And while I am not foggy, the jitteriness makes it difficult to concentrate so it is the opposite end of the same problem. I am still taking two daily doses of Ultracet and believe me, the titration off that is pretty miserable anyway. So less pain but more other problems. I am not working right now - thank heavens - so I can stay at home. It is difficult to compare this to how bad I used to feel but I do remember sleeping in the bathtub frequently because the fibro pain was so terrible. I think it is worth trying and if you have a good doctor who can help you manage the side effects without too many other drugs with side effects, this may be as good as it gets. I'm also guessing that the "one size fits all" dosage probably won't work for everyone either. But it has to get better than it is today or otherwise it will simply be another drug to cross off the list and I'll go back to Ultracet only.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: cc, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 20+ year fibromyalgia pt. with RA and now Facet Joint Arthritis. Savella was strongly suggested by my great rhuemtologist. I'm not sure if all the side effects were the new drug or coming off the old. I had nausea,hot flashes,no appetite, lost weight(good thing) its back now(a bad thing). I wantd to encourage new users. I am less fuzzy, I have more energy, trigger point pain initially was reduced may be similar to before now but I'll take the clarity anytime! I got through the first 30 days by increasing the mg titration slower. With my Dr's blessing I did 25mg longer by cutting the 50's, then I went to 25 in AM and 50 at night, then over a weekend I did the 50/50 and managed not to retrigger the nausua. Soft peppermints and saltines were my friends for over 30 days. I'd be more positive on effectiveness if I had more back pain relief but with the Lumbar facet problem I can't hold it against the med. Ease of use would be higher and I think they should give new users a longer start up time. Give it a 30 day + trial and anyone with the nausea should ask their dr to go slower.

column1: Disorder characterized by Stiff, Tender &amp; Painful Muscles
column2: SavellaIsGREAT, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Savella works great. But the first week of side effects while titrating are a bit uncomfortable. After that, it's WONDERFUL for energy, pain & brain fog, although it takes a couple of months to see a dramatic improvement. IGNORE any reviews from people who stopped taking it after the first week, because they most likely didn't take it properly & just aren't giving it a real chance to work. Savella isn't a pain pill; it doesn't work instantly. Very important to remember: TAKE SAVELLA EARLY & TAKE IT WITH FOOD; always take it with food. I take it at 5 a.m. & 2 a.m. (for 7 weeks now). If not taken correctly, it'll cause headaches/nausea. Don't give up; just give it at least two months to work.I take my doses halfway through my meals. If you take the second dose too late in the day, it'll interfere with sleep. The second dose should be taken before 2 p.m.Unfortunately, doctors also aren't telling patients that Savella is an SNRI so it SHOULD NOT be taken w/ other antidepressants or it'll make you sick (serotonin syndrome). Take it properly & give it a chance - because Savella helps A LOT for fibro sufferers! Wonderful for pain, energy & fibro fog. TAKE IT RIGHT, AND IT WILL HELP! DON'T DISCOURAGE OTHERS IF YOU DIDN'T TAKE SAVELLA CORRECTLY. IT TAKES LONGER THAN A WEEK TO FULLY WORK. IF YOU'RE NOT TAKING IT LONG ENOUGH, YOU'RE CHEATING YOURSELF!
